pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:0.4: The sub-chapter on containing living beings
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.2: At that time Venerable Udāyī was skilled in archery. And because he disliked crows,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.3: he shot them. He cut off their heads and then set them out in a row impaled on stakes.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.8: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.9: “How can Venerable Udāyī intentionally kill living beings?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.10: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.13: “Foolish man, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.15: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.16.1: ‘If a monk intentionally kills a living being, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.6: knowing, perceiving, having intended, having decided, he transgresses.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.8: an animal is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.10: if he cuts off and makes an end of the life faculty, if he destroys its continuity, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.1: If it is a living being, and he perceives it as such, and he kills it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.2: If it is a living being, but he is unsure of it, and he kills it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.3: If it is a living being, but he does not perceive it as such, and he kills it, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.4: If it is not a living being, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.5: If it is not a living being, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.6: If it is not a living being, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.5: if he is not aiming at death;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.8: The training rule on intentionally, the first, is finished.
